snippet: The United Nations General Assembly voted 133 to 12 on Friday for a resolution that severely criticized the Syrian government for killings and other atrocities.
abstract: United Nations General Assembly votes overwhelmingly for Arab-backed resolution that severely criticizes the Syrian government, blaming it almost exclusively for the killings and other atrocities during the 17-month-old uprising there.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly voted 133 to 12 on Friday for a resolution that severely criticized the Syrian government for killings and other atrocities.

headline.main: After Council’s Deadlock, Syria Is Criticized at U.N.
headline.print_headline: After Council’s Deadlock, Syria Is Criticized at U.N.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
